titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Leland Barrows papers, 1942-1987
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aparna Mukherjee

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-26T16:27-0800

change.item: Declassified records series added to file by Sarah Patton.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Leland Barrows Papers)//EN" "barrowsl.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 26 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, studies, reports, memoranda, and printed matter relating to American foreign relations with South Vietnam and with Africa, especially Cameroon, Nigeria and South Africa; and to American government policy, especially as reflected in activities of the Agency for International Development, regarding foreign aid and development assistance, and promotion of foreign trade.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Leland Barrows papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1997.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Leland J. Barrows was born in Lawrence, Kansas; he received his bachelor's and master's degrees in political science from the University of Kansas. Before World War II he worked in the Department of Agriculture, and during the war he was the Assistant Director of the War Relocation Authority.

Barrows joined the State Department in 1947 as Deputy Director of the Office of Informational and Educational Exchange and served in Paris, Rome, Athens, and Saigon as Chief of the International Cooperation Administration's mission. He also served as Regional Director for the Near East and South Asia. During the years 1960 to 1961 he served as Ambassador to Cameroon and Togo.

Upon retiring from the State Department in 1966, Barrows joined the Graduate School of Public and International Affairs at the University of Pittsburgh. He also served as a senior staff member at the Research Analysis Corporation, as the assistant to the president of the Washington Technical Institute, and as a member of the Center for Strategic and International Studies at Georgetown University.
Barrows died in Washington, D.C. on March 3, 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Leland J. Barrows papers relate mainly to American foreign relations with South Vietnam and with Africa, especially Cameroon, Nigeria, and South Africa; and to American government policy, as reflected in the activities of the Agency for International Development, regarding foreign aid and promotion of foreign trade.

Papers that were either created by Barrows or collected by him for his projects or assignments in a professional capacity (whether as an ambassador, a senior staff member of an organization, or a member of the faculty of a university) were incorporated in the CAREER FILE. Within that large series, materials that were clearly associated with a particular position can be found under the name of the appropriate government agency, organization, or university. Those that were not are filed by the subject they cover. All other materials, either collected by Barrows for general interest or generated by others, were placed in the SUBJECT FILE.

These records bear testimony to Barrows' knowledge and expertise in the areas of U.S. foreign relations and foreign trade. Of particular interest are his reports on the Vietnam commercial import program and on race relations in South Africa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, brochures, chronological records, clippings, contracts, correspondence, interviews, itinerary, lists, memoranda, messages, newsletters, notes, outlines, programs, reports, schedule, statements, study, survey, and miscellany relating to professional activities of Leland J. Barrows, either created by Leland Barrows or collected by him in a professional capacity, arranged alphabetically by name of government agency, organization, or university. See also: SUBJECT FILE and SPEECHES AND WRITINGS.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 14 prints depicting Leland Barrows, Dwight D. Eisenhower, and Phan-Tat-Thanh, the organizational structure of the U.S. Department of Agriculture, and railway tracks and trains in Cameroon.

did.unittitle: 2 photographs of Phan-Tat-Thanh holding a personal letter from Dwight D. Eisenhower, including one with Leland Barrows, Director, United States Operations Mission (USOM), and one showing a photograph of the President on the wall,
2 photographs of Phan-Tat-Thanh with the statuette of La Dong Tan, including one with Leland Barrows, and one of the letter from Dwight D. Eisenhower,
1 photograph depicting the organizational structure of the U.S. Department of Agriculture for the war effort,
9 photographs of railway tracks and trains in Cameroon,

scopecontent.p: Map of the United States, sample letter of introduction, and transparencies and related texts used for overhead projector, arranged alphabetically by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Includes some interfiled, unclassified government records. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, memoranda, and correspondence relating to Vietnam, particularly from an aid/economic perspective, that appear to be from Barrow's work with the Research Analysis Corporation (RAC).
